channel.title: Heapdump on chamila.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Heapdump on chamila.dev

item.title: Extracting memory and thread dumps from a running JRE based JVM
item.description: Almost every Java developer knows about jmapand jstack tools that come with the JDK. These provide functionality to extract heap and thread information of a running JVM instance. Easy. What if there’s a running JVM that has produced a deadlock and you want to take a thread dump while the process is running? You go in and run the following. jstack pid >> thread_dump.txt Turns out the system doesn’t know what jstack is.
